sources.title: Ramona (1928)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. Dolores Del Rio stars in this synchronized sound romance drama based on the 1884 novel. Its story follows a mixed Native-American/Mexican woman who falls in love with a Native man, with both of them facing racism and discrimination. Critics enjoyed the scenery, characters and acting, and box office was quite good for the time. Ramona was thought to be lost for decades before a print was rediscovered in 2010.

metadata.Plot: Ramona refuses to marry her step/adopted brother, Felipe. She runs away and is found by an American Indian that she falls in love with and marries. She has a son with her Indian husband but the husband and child both die. Ramona goes crazy with grief and runs into the wilderness. Felipe finds her, saving her life and bringing her back to health, and the two reconcile.
metadata.Actors: Dolores Del Río, Warner Baxter, Roland Drew
